entry.title: The Local Government Finance (Scotland) Amendment Order 2011
entry.summary: This Order amends the Local Government Finance (Scotland) Order 2011 by replacing Schedule1 to that Order with the Schedule1 set out in the Schedule to this Order. Column2 of the Schedule lists the amount of revenue support grant which is payable to each local authority in Scotland in respect of the financial year 2011-2012. Column3 of the Schedule lists the amount of non-domestic rate income to be distributed to each local authority in Scotland in respect of the financial year 2011-2012.

entry.title: The Data Protection Act 1998 (Commencement No. 3) Order 2011
entry.summary: This is the third Commencement Order made under the Data Protection Act 1998.

title.div: The National Assembly for Wales (Returning Officers' Accounts) Regulations 2011 / Rheoliadau Cynulliad Cenedlaethol Cymru (Cyfrifon Swyddogion Canlyniadau) 2011

div.p: These Regulations provide for the time when, manner and form in which accounts are to be rendered to the Welsh Ministers by returning officers in connection with the National Assembly for Wales elections.

Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn yn darparu ar gyfer yr adeg y mae Swyddogion Canlyniadau i ddychwelyd cyfrifon i Weinidogion Cymru mewn cysylltiad ag etholiadau Cynulliad Cenedlaethol Cymru, ac yn darparu ar gyfer dull a ffurf y cyfrifon hynny.

entry.title: The Pneumoconiosis, etc., (Workers’ Compensation) (Payment of Claims) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2011
entry.summary: Under the Pneumoconiosis, etc., (Workers’ Compensation) (Northern Ireland) Order 1979 (“the Order”) lump sum payments may be made to certain persons disabled by a disease to which the Order applies, or to dependants of persons who were so disabled before they died.

entry.title: The Local Government Finance (Scotland) Amendment Order 2011
entry.summary: This Order amends the Local Government Finance (Scotland) Order 2011 by replacing Schedule1 to that Order with the Schedule1 set out in the Schedule to this Order. Column2 of the Schedule lists the amount of revenue support grant which is payable to each local authority in Scotland in respect of the financial year 2011-2012. Column3 of the Schedule lists the amount of non-domestic rate income to be distributed to each local authority in Scotland in respect of the financial year 2011-2012.

entry.title: The Climate Change Levy (General) (Amendment) Regulations 2011
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Climate Change Levy (General) Regulations 2001 (S.I. 2001/838, the “General Regulations”).

title.div: The Food (Jelly Mini-Cups) (Emergency Control) (Wales) (Revocation) Regulations 2011 / Rheoliadau Bwyd (Jeli Cwpanau Bach) (Rheolaeth Frys) (Cymru) (Dirymu) 2011

entry.title: The Seeds (National Lists of Varieties) (Amendment) Regulations 2011
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Seeds (National Lists of Varieties) Regulations 2001 ( S.I. 2001/3510) to implement in part Commission Directive 2009/145/EC (OJ No L 312, 27/11/2009, p.44). Those Regulations make provision for the entry of varieties on to the National List, so that the seeds of those varieties can then be certified and marketed.

entry.title: The Conservation of Habitats and Species (Amendment) Regulations 2011
The Justices’ Clerks (Amendment) Rules 2011
entry.summary: These Rules amend the Justices’ Clerks Rules 2005 (S.I. 2005/545) (“the 2005 Rules”). Rule 5 inserts a new rule 3A in the 2005 Rules to provide that where a justices’ clerk is performing certain functions and considers it inappropriate to perform those functions, the justices’ clerk must refer the matter to a magistrates’ court.

entry.title: The Marine and Coastal Access Act 2009 (Transitional and Savings Provisions) Order 2011
entry.summary: This Order makes transitional and savings provisions consequential on the repeal of the Sea Fisheries Regulation Act 1966 (c.38) when the Orders creating the sea fisheries districts for which local fisheries committees were constituted will lapse.

title.div: The National Assembly for Wales (Returning Officers' Charges) Order 2011 / Gorchymyn Cynulliad Cenedlaethol Cymru (Taliadau Swyddogion Canlyniadau) 2011

div.p: This Order provides for payments for services and expenses of returning officers in connection with the conduct of National Assembly for Wales elections which are to be held together with the Alternative Vote Referendum for parliamentary elections on the same date in 2011. The amounts indicated in this Order as being the maximum recoverable amounts for services and expenses of returning officers have taken into consideration the provisions contained within the Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Act 2011 which requires that these costs be apportioned equally between the Alternative Vote Referendum and the National Assembly for Wales elections..

Mae'r Gorchymyn hwn yn darparu ar gyfer taliadau am wasanaethau a threuliau swyddogion canlyniadau mewn cysylltiad â chynnal etholiadau Cynulliad Cenedlaethol Cymru, sydd i'w cynnal ar y cyd â'r Refferendwm Pleidlais Amgen ar gyfer etholiadau seneddol ar yr un dyddiad yn 2011. Mae'r symiau a ddynodir yn y Gorchymyn hwn fel y cyfansymiau cyffredinol mwyaf am wasanaethau a threuliau swyddogion canlyniadau wedi cymryd i ystyriaeth y darpariaethau a gynhwysir yn Neddf System Bleidleisio Seneddol ac Etholaethau 2011 sydd yn ei gwneud yn ofynnol bod y costau hyn yn cael eu rhannu'n gyfartal rhwng y Refferendwm Pleidlais Amgen ac etholiadau Cynulliad Cenedlaethol Cymru.

entry.title: The Animal By-Products (Enforcement) (Wales) Regulations 2011
entry.summary: These Regulations enforce, in Wales, Regulation (EC) No 1069/2009 of the European Parliament and of the Council on laying down health rules as regards animal by-products and derived products not intended for human consumption and repealing Regulation (EC) No 1774/2002. (OJ No L 300, 14.11.2009, p.1) (“the EU Control Regulation”).

entry.title: The Fostering Services (England) Regulations 2011
entry.summary: These Regulations, which come into force on 1st April 2011, are made under the Children Act 1989 and the Care Standards Act 2000. They revoke, and substantially replace, the Fostering Services Regulations 2002.

entry.title: The Seed Potatoes (Crop Fees) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2011
entry.summary: These Regulations increase the fee payable to the Department of Agriculture and Rural Development in respect of the certification of seed potato crops arising under the Seed Potatoes Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2001 (regulations 2, 3 and the Schedule).

entry.title: The Magistrates’ Courts (Criminal Justice (Children)) (Amendment) Rules (Northern Ireland) 2011
entry.summary: These Rules amend the Magistrates’ Courts (Criminal Justice (Children)) Rules (Northern Ireland) 1999 [S.R.1999 No.7] to remove the reference to Article 15 of the Criminal Justice (Children) (Northern Ireland) Order 1998 in the heading of Form 1.

entry.title: The Extreme Pornography (Electronic Commerce Directive) (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 2011
entry.summary: These Regulations amend regulation4(2)(b) of the Extreme Pornography (Electronic Commerce Directive) (Scotland) Regulations 2011 (“the principal Regulations”).

entry.title: The Scottish Parliament (Regional Returning Officers) Order 2011
entry.summary: This Order designates, for the purposes of the Scotland Act 1998, the person who is the regional returning officer for each Scottish Parliament region. Paragraph 2 of Schedule 1 to the 1998 Act provides for there to be eight regions for the purposes of the Act and for seven regional members to be returned for each region. The regions are now specified in the Scottish Parliament (Constituencies and Regions) Order 2010 (S.I. 2010/2691). Regional returning officers perform functions, conferred by or under the 1998 Act, in relation to the election and return of regional members of the Scottish Parliament. This Order revokes the previous Order made under section 12(6) of the 1998 Act (which designated regional returning officers for the regions which existed prior to the coming into force of S.I. 2010/2691).

entry.title: The Magistrates’ Courts (Amendment) Rules (Northern Ireland) 2011
entry.summary: These Rules amend the Magistrates’ Courts (Northern Ireland) Rules 1984 (S.R.1984 No.225) (“the principal Rules”) to amend the procedure around entering a plea of guilty by post, prescribe the procedure relating to applications in respect of investigation anonymity orders under section 77-85 of the Coroners and Justice Act 2009 (‘the 2009 Act’), and make a number of minor technical amendments to Forms 1 and 1A.

title.div: The Welsh Forms of Oaths and Affirmations (Government of Wales Act 2006) (Amendment) Order 2011 / Gorchymyn Ffurfiau Cymraeg Llwon a Chadarnhadau (Deddf Llywodraeth Cymru 2006) (Diwygio) 2011

div.p: This order amends the Welsh Forms of Oaths and Affirmations (Government of Wales Act 2006) Order 2007 (S.I. 2007/2044 (W.169)), which prescribes Welsh forms of the oaths and affirmations which members of the National Assembly for Wales and certain members of the Welsh Assembly Government are required to take under the Government of Wales Act 2006 (c. 32) (“the 2006 Act”).

Mae'r gorchymyn hwn yn diwygio Gorchymyn Ffurfiau Cymraeg Llwon a Chadarnhadau (Deddf Llywodraeth Cymru 2006) 2007 (O.S. 2007/2044 (Cy. 169)), sy'n rhagnodi ffurfiau Cymraeg y llwon y mae'n ofynnol i aelodau Cynulliad Cenedlaethol Cymru ac aelodau penodol o Lywodraeth Cynulliad Cymru eu cymryd a'r cadarnhadau y mae'n ofynnol iddynt eu rhoi o dan Ddeddf Llywodraeth Cymru 2006 (p.32) (“Deddf 2006”).
